body_html:
Despite the title change, I do still think specifying algorithm='sequential' and algorithm='parallel' params to tf.stack(), then deprecating tf.parallel_stack() would be cleaner. The description can of course specify all the useful information currently present in both docstrings, plus 'parallel' is faster for some use cases, but does not support backpropagation.

Just figured I'd plug the idea one more time, no worries if you decide to stick to a docstring only change. :-)

The description can of course specify all the useful information currently present in both docstrings, plus 'parallel' is faster for some use cases, but does not support backpropagation.
Just figured I'd plug the idea one more time, no worries if you decide to stick to a docstring only change. :-)
body:
Despite the title change, I do still think specifying `algorithm='sequential'` and `algorithm='parallel'` params to `tf.stack()`, then deprecating `tf.parallel_stack()` would be cleaner. The description can of course specify all the useful information currently present in both docstrings, plus `'parallel' is faster for some use cases, but does not support backpropagation`.

Just figured I'd plug the idea one more time, no worries if you decide to stick to a docstring only change. :-)
